page.title: 10RECREATION
page.content: If you were a tourist and like history, you would like to come to Lingfield to its many old and interesting buildings. The cage (or lock_up) was built in the 18th Century and last used in 1882. This is by the old oak tree which is on the village crest. Gun Pit Road reminds us of the days when guns were made here, The Star Pub of Starborough Castle. The mainly 14th Century church is large and beautiful with cruesaders' tombs. Nearby is Old Town, some very old houses, once shops. The library is in the old church guest_house.
